metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2213 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The KRandom::random function in KDE Paste Applet after 4.10.5 inkdeplasma-addons uses the GNU C Library rand function's linear congruentialgenerator, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to defeatcryptographic protection mechanisms by predicting the generator output.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdeplasma-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-containments-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-dataengines-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-runners-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-wallpapers-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widget-kdeobservatory - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widget-kimpanel - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widget-lancelot - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widgets-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: kdeplasma-addons package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1').
